title: Transforming Food Systems: Youth Innovation for Human and Planetary Health.
author: Chigozie Paul
synopsis: According to a 2019 UN Report, the world's population is expected to increase by 2 billion persons in the next 30 years. We believe that through sensitization, education, and empowerment, we can inspire youths to create entrepreneurial solutions that can bring about changes, including sustainable food systems.

title: Digital Literacy
author: Gladys John
synopsis: A person’s identity is who they are, and/or what makes them unique. In the context of our digital world, a literate person is knowledgeable, competent and up-todate with basic digital tools. A digital literate must possess digital skills which birth the competency to use digital devices independently.

title: Make Room: How to encourage Women Participation in Tech.
author: Chigozie Paul
synopsis: It is no longer news that all over the world, women are side-lined in the tech industry. This is majorly because of stereotypes. These stereotypes are birthed and upheld by society and culture. It is even a struggle in some underdeveloped countries before young girls and women can get basic education.

title: World Youths Skills Day: Reimagining Youth Skills Post-Pandemic
author: Chigozie Paul & Gladys John
synopsis: The World Youths Skills Day is a day set aside yearly to celebrate the strategic importance of equipping young people with employment, decent work, and entrepreneurship skills. This day was first set aside by the United Nations (UN) in 2014 in alignment with Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) 8; Decent Work and Economic Growth. Since then, World Youth Skills Day has been the perfect platform for proper dialogue on the importance of Technical and Vocational Training (TVET) organisations for youth development.

title: Myths About Women in Tech
author: Oluwasefunmi Obielodan
synopsis: According to the World Economic Forum’s annual Global Gender Gap index, 2015, women make-up half the population and earn more advanced degrees than men in 100 countries… Why then are they a distinct minority in Tech?

title: Importance of Cultural Diversity for Non-Profit Organisations
author: Blessing Ashi
synopsis: In 1941, Mahnaz Afkhami an Iranian-American Human rights activist quoted “We have the ability to achieve—if we master the necessary goodwill—a common global society blessed with a shared culture of peace that is nourished by the ethnic, national and local diversities that enrich our lives”.

title: Inclusion of Women in Technology: A Stimulus for the African Economy
author: Terkimbi Joshua
synopsis: Technology in today's world is no longer seen as an exclusive right of a few but rather a way of life that necessitates integration and inclusion for all. The most integral part of technology’s impact on the African economy is still tied to internet penetration per country, closing gender gaps, and creating access to opportunities for digital skill development for all Africans.

title: Is learning and working remotely the new normal?
author: Diwura Oladepo
synopsis: In light of the pandemic, we had to think quickly and rapidly of alternative ways to impact our beneficiaries without having to meet them physically.

title: The role light plays in science, culture, education and sustainable development
author: Rebecca Nzerem
synopsis: It is common knowledge that light plays an important role in the continued existence of man. Since the birth of light in 1876 by the great Thomas Edison, humanity has not looked back since.

title: 21st Century Technology Advancement and Women Participation
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The World we live in is dynamic; hence the constant changes we see around us. There is an increase in the number of women in technology which has brought with it an increased sense of self among women across the World.

title: Girls must have a Seat at the ICT table.
author: Diwura Oladepo
synopsis: Taking a journey down memory lane, during our pilot women coding program, Code4Impact, we trained 70 girls from University of Lagos(UNILAG), Lagos State University(LASU), Ladoke Akintola University of Technology(LAUTECH) and Yaba College of Technology(YABATECH).

title: Digital skills as a tool to unlock the african economy
author: Terkimbi Joshua
synopsis: Working on the Nigerian Women Techsters (NWT) Initiative has exposed me to the limitless opportunities that can emerge from empowering women and the importance of consciously creating enabling environments for programs that impact communities through human capital development.

title: Massive opportunities for women in technology.
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: As the old wisdom goes, if you lost your job, you could blame to suspects cheap labor in the developing world or computers, of course, it is a truism that technological change causes disruption in economies, but it is much greater step to argue that it causes unemployment, in fact the opposite seems to be true.

title: Why we need more women in tech in Nigeria
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: Tech4Dev (Technology for Social Change and Development) initiated The Nigerian Women Techsters program, a program to train 2,400 women on programming skills in Nigeria.

title: Women Techsters Fellowship Mini Demo Day.
author: Chigozie Paul
synopsis: On the 5th and 6th July, the Women Techsters Fellows had a mini demo day to showcase what they have learned so far and prepare for their final project. In total, 28 groups had presentations to make. Various groups duly represented each learning track. We had six groups, nine groups, two groups, six groups, and five groups respectively in product design, software development, product management, Data Science, and Ai and Cybersecurity learning tracks.

title: Tech4Dev’s Mental Health Awareness Event.
author: Chigozie Paul
synopsis: Every year, the month of May is set aside to create awareness around Mental health. In general terms, mental health is the emotional well-being of an individual. For a very long while, mental health has been viewed as less important than the state of the body, especially in this part of the world. But statistics have shown that the state of one's mental health is, in fact, just as important as the state of the person's body.

title: Tech4Dev Launches the First Edition of the Women Techsters Fellowship Program Under the Women Techsters Initiative in Partnership with Microsoft
author: Oluwatoyin Akande
synopsis: Men in tech usually exceed women in tech by at least a 3:1 ratio or even higher in some sectors. As part of the commitment to bridge the digital divide between men and women in the Tech sector, Tech4Dev launched the first edition of The Women Techsters Fellowship on Monday, the 26th of April 2021.

title: Congratulations to Microsoft Leap Engineering Girls (Cohort 2)
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Women Techsters program has had another success as two of our beneciaries got into the 2nd cohort of the Microsoft Leap Engineering program.

title: ATC Digital Village Graduation Ceremony in Kebbi
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: We have had another record breakthrough as 23 youths graduated from the digital skills training in Argungu, Kebbi State.

title: Microsoft Philanthropies features a story on Women Techsters
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: It is one thing to do the work and another to be recognized for it: This is why we are excited about the Women Techsters story featured on the Microsoft website.

title: Minister of Youth and Sport Visits ATC DV in Agege
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Honorable Minister of Youth and Sport for the Federal Republic of Nigeria, Honorable Sunday Dare recently paid a courtesy visit to one of the ATC Digital Village centers in Agege, Lagos State.

title: Tech4Dev visits Makoko Community for ATC Digital Village
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: Tech4Dev representatives joined an introductory meeting held in the Makoko community at the Digital Village Center on 18th February 2020.

title: Nigerian Women Techsters Lagos Cohort 1
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Nigerian Women Techsters initiative, with the goal of training 2,400 women across 12 states in Nigeria, is rounding up with the Lagos cohort. The program will introduce learners to digital and analytical skills to kick start a career in tech.

title: Nakise-GIZ Cohort 4
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Nakise offline training is on its 4th cohort in partnership with Nigerian-German Centre for Jobs, Migration, and Re-integration, with the objective to train youths on employability and workplace efficiency skills.

title: Women Techsters – GIZ Cohort 4
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: With our continued resolve to bridge the gap of gender equality in the technology ecosystem, our partnership with The Nigerian-German Centre for Jobs, Migration, and Reintegration has birthed the 4th cohort of the Women Techsters training.

title: Nigeria Women Techsters – Imo Closing/Demo Day
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Imo state Nigerian Women Techsters training held in Owerri, Imo state, has successfully trained 270 women on digital and deep tech skills.

title: Women Techsters selected as the only Nigerian Solution at the UN Solutions Summit
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: We were at the UN Solution Summit, a catalytic gathering at the United Nations Headquarters during UN General Assembly Week. It was an exciting experience; we were selected for the Summit to present our solution ‘Women Techsters” in New York.

title: Congratulations to the Microsoft Leap Engineering Girls
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: Fatima, Abiodun, and Bello were beneficiaries of the Women Techsters program in the 2nd and 3rd cohort; they were amateurs to coding before joining the WT program. The Women Techsters is an initiative of Tech4Dev that trains women and girls on digital and deep tech skills.

title: Nakise-GIZ Cohort 4 Offline Program
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: We just concluded 4th Nakise offline cohort in partnership with Nigerian-German for Jobs, Migration and re-integration.

title: Women Techsters - GIZ Cohort 3 Internship
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Women Techsters beneficiaries are currently undergoing their internship where they will gain hands on experience based on their learnings on web development.

title: Nakise-GIZ Cohort 2&3 Offline Program
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The NAKISE program is an initiative that is built to foster employability, entrepreneurship, and enable workplace efficiency. The NAKISE offline program organized in partnership with organizations trains youths on essential career skills.

title: Nigerian Women Techsters - Kano Closing/Demo Day
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: Kano state took part in the experiential learning program of the Nigerian Women Techsters starting from 4th May 2019 to 6th July 2019. The Demo day/closing ceremony held at the Startup Kano Hub on 13th July 2019 with 90 women graduating from the program.

title: Women Techsters in Partnership with German Centre for Jobs, Migration and Re-Integration Cohort 3 Closing/Demo Day Program
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Nigerian Women Techsters started its training program in Imo state. The training kick-started on 15th June 2019 with the opening ceremony.The cohort started on 3rd June through 19th June 2019. The training was a two weeks’ intensive boot camp covering Web and Mobile development.

title: Nigerian Women Techsters – Imo State Training Program
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Nigerian Women Techsters started its training program in Imo state. The training kick-started on 15th June 2019 with the opening ceremony.The opening day had in attendance over 130 women from the different local government areas parts of Imo state; dignitaries, guests from the Office of the First Lady Imo State and Office of the Secretary to the State Government were also present.

title: Nigerian Women Techsters – Delta State Closing/Demo Day
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Nigerian Women Techsters program empowers women in underserved communities, giving them leverage to build careers in technology, study STEM courses and run their tech businesses or manage technology-leveraged enterprises.

title: Nakise Offline Pilot Cohort
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The NAKISE program is an initiative that is built to foster employability, entrepreneurship, and enable workplace efficiency. Nakise.ng is an online platform that is equipped with learning materials to enhance users with knowledge for competence in business and corporate work.

title: NWT Delta State Training
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: The Nigerian Women Techsters started its 3rd cohort in Warri, Delta state. On 20th March 2019, The training is divided into three primary tracks: web and mobile development, games development, and embedded systems.

title: Nigerian-German Centre for Jobs, Migration and Re-integration partners with TECH4DEV on Women Techsters
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: Tech4Dev has successfully graduated another of a set of Women Techsters powered by Nigerian-German Centre for Jobs, Migration, and Re6-integration (GIZ).

title: NWT Kano State Training
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: On 4th May 2019, the NWT training started in Kano state with 96 women in attendance on the first day of training. The women were introduced to the relevance of acquiring tech skills and opportunities within the tech space in the 21st century.

title: TECHDEV HOLDS ROUND TABLE CONVERSATION THEMED REIMAGINING YOUTH SKILLS POST-PANDEMIC TO MARK WORLD YOUTH SKILLS DAY 2021
author: Oluwatoyin Akande
synopsis: The World Youth Skills Day is an annual event organized by the United Nations (UN) to celebrate the importance of empowering youths with decent work, employment, and entrepreneurship skills. The focus of this year’s celebration is the resilience and the creativity of youths during the pandemic while discussing the roles that Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) systems have played in youth empowerment and the strategies to be adopted in the post-COVID-19 world.

title: Tech4Dev Partners with the Federal Ministry of Youth and Sports Development on Reducing Unemployment in Nigeria by upskilling 36,000 youths.
author: Chigozie Paul
synopsis: The rate of unemployment in Nigeria has been on an upward trend over the past couple of years. According to the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS), the Nigerian economy suffered another coronavirus-induced setback, as unemployment rate jumped from 27.1% as at Q2’2020 to 33.3% as at Q4’2020. Correspondingly, the number of unemployed persons rose by 6.4% to 23.2 million as at Q4’2020 from 21.8 million as at Q2’2020. The current unemployment rate is the highest ever, with unemployment scourge being magnified by COVID-19 crisis. According to Statista.com, the unemployment rate in Nigeria is estimated to reach 32.5 per cent in 2021. This figure is projected to increase further in 2022.

title: Tech4Dev Announces Partnership with OK Foundation to Empower 1000 Youths with Digital Skills in Badagry
author: Chigozie Paul
synopsis: On the 20th of May, Tech4Dev, in alliance with the Olu Kosoko Foundation (OK Foundation), declared the Badagry Digital Center open at 40th Birthday Ceremony of Prince Olu Kosoko of Iworo Kingdom, Badagry. This partnership was birthed due to the alarming rate of low involvement of Nigerian youths in the acquisition of digital skills.

title: The Women Techsters Initiative; A Solution Advancing Science, Technology and Innovation
author: Chigozie Paul
synopsis: According to a 2020 UN Report, The COVID-19 pandemic has created the most significant disruption of education systems in history, affecting nearly 1.6 billion learners in more than 190 countries and all continents. This was one of the themes discussed at the Science Technology and Innovation (STI) Forum. The STI Forum is a global information platform focused on science, technology and innovation for Sustainable Development Goals. Over the years, this platform has become a dedicated virtual open source for knowledge sharing and dissemination of information in terms of research and innovation.

title: Tech4Dev Holds Stakeholders' Engagement Forum Post Basic Digital Literacy for Rural Clusters in Northern Nigeria program.
author: Yemisi Arowosafe
synopsis: In a time of social distancing and government-enforced lockdowns to curtail the spread of COVID-19, digital technology has enabled the continuation of work, education, and communication. But for millions of people who are unable to use technology, being offline is economically and socially isolating.

title: Tech4Dev Announces Strategic Partnership with the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO) on Digital Literacy Training in Northern Nigeria.
author: Yemisi Arowosafe
synopsis: As part of the efforts to empower vulnerable groups in rural clusters in Northern Nigeria with the digital skill set required for the future of work and advanced learnings for the 21st century in Nigeria, Technology for Social Change and Development Initiative (Tech4Dev)...

title: Women Techsters Initiative Launch: Inclusivity for 5 million Women in the African Tech Industry.
author: Rebecca Nzerem
synopsis: On International Women's Day 2021, Tech4Dev, in partnership with Microsoft, held a launch event for its Women Techsters Initiative.

title: Tech4Dev Is Providing Solutions to Enable Decent Work
author: Diwura Oladepo
synopsis: With the advent of technological evolution, the world is changing rapidly; from how we communicate to how we conduct business to how we work. Daily lives and communication have been subsumed by the use of social media where interactions with people across the globe takes places in the new world of social; a world of interconnectivity and speedy communications.

title: Women Techsters Beneficiaries Spotlight: Jessica Tebogo
author: Chigozie Paul
synopsis: Asides equipping women with digital and deep tech skills to bridge the gender divide within the technology ecosystems, one of the major objectives of the Women Techsters initiative is to help these women access decent work and gain financial independence and stability.

title: Partner Spotlight: Microsoft.
author: Chigozie Paul
synopsis: Asides from being a multinational organisation, Microsoft is also an enterprise deeply invested in corporate philanthropy. Since its existence, Microsoft has partnered with many organisations to achieve technological advancements in different parts of the world, especially in Africa. As of April 1, 2021, Microsoft Corporation disclosed that through its Global Skilling Initiative (GSI), it has helped over 30 million people in 249 countries and territories gain access to digital skills, topping its initial goal of 25 million last June.

title: Advisory Board Member Spotlight: Blossom Ozurumba
author: Yemisi Arowosafe
synopsis: I currently work as the Innovation Advisor to the Chief Innovation Officer of the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation.

title: Advisory Board Member Spotlight: Ifeyinwa Egwaoje
author: Yemisi Arowosafe
synopsis: When women are excluded from the digital technology transformation, it magnifies existing inequalities and forestalls development.

title: ALUMNI SPOTLIGHT: Temilade Adelakun
author: Yemisi Arowosafe
synopsis: Tell us your Tech4Dev Story: I saw a graphic design about the Nigerian Women Techsters Initiative on one of the many WhatsApp groups I was in...

title: ALUMNI SPOTLIGHT: Gift O. Maduabuchi
author: Yemisi Arowosafe
synopsis: Your background? I grew up in a Godly family. I am the only girl, surrounded by two lovely boys. I engage in male-dominated activities, such as playing football...

title: Advisory Board Member Spotlight: Olatomiwa Williams
author: Yemisi Arowosafe
synopsis: My passion for diversity in the technology industry drives my involvement in different initiatives focused on encouraging and developing diverse talents within the Information Technology Industry.

title: Volunteer Spotlight: Emeka Ofe
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: My name is Emeka Ofe, a software engineer. I studied Chemical Engineering at the Federal University of Technology Owerri, Imo State, I switched my career from Chemical Engineering to Software Engineering due to my burning passion for software engineering. The journey has been thrilling so far.

title: Volunteer of the Month – Arinze Odika
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: Arinze Odika is a 300 level student of Accountancy at the Imo State University Owerri. He volunteers as a local programs manager for the NWTImo program.

title: Volunteer of the month – Umar Farouk
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: Farouq Umar is a writer, content developer, system analyst, program, and project manager. He also works as the Programs Manager at Startup Kano Hub.

title: Volunteer Spotlight: Meet Chris Adie
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: Our volunteer of the month is Chris Adie, a tutor for Nigerian Women Techsters in Delta state and Women Techsters in Lagos state. In a short interview Chris answers vital questions on volunteering

title: Alumni Spotlight: Catherine John
author: Oluwatosin Omowaire
synopsis: Meet Catherine John, a beneficiary of the Women Techsters Cohort 2. Catherine recently got into the Microsoft Leap Hackathon, and her team won the grand prize.
